entry.title: Kingfisher payment crisis resolved, oil supply resumed
entry.content: In a major breather for cash-strapped Kingfisher Airlines, the oil companies on Thursday resumed fuel supply to it after reportedly receiving full payment from the crisis-hit airlines. http://ibnlive.com/livetv

media:group.media:description: In a major breather for cash-strapped Kingfisher Airlines, the oil companies on Thursday resumed fuel supply to it after reportedly receiving full payment from the crisis-hit airlines. http://ibnlive.com/livetv

media:group.media:title: Kingfisher payment crisis resolved, oil supply resumed

entry.title: UP: SP workers in another act of violence
entry.content: Violence broke out on Wednesday night outside an independent candidate's house in Sitapur area of Uttar Pradesh, after alleged Samajwadi Party workers tried to set his and 13 other houses on fire. Two people have been arrested in connection with the incident. They are allegedly supporters of SP MLA Jeena Babu. http://ibnlive.com/livetv

media:group.media:description: Violence broke out on Wednesday night outside an independent candidate's house in Sitapur area of Uttar Pradesh, after alleged Samajwadi Party workers tried to set his and 13 other houses on fire. Two people have been arrested in connection with the incident. They are allegedly supporters of SP MLA Jeena Babu. http://ibnlive.com/livetv
media:group.media:keywords: UP Polls, UP Elections 2012, Samajwadi Party, SP, Akhilesh Yadav, Violence, Gunfire, 7-year-old child dead, Journalists stoned, stone pelting, Sitapur, Independent candidate, House on fire, Jhansi

entry.title: Passengers bear the brunt as Kingfisher crisis continues
entry.content: It couldn't have gotten worse for the people looking to celebrate the festival of colours with their near and dear ones. Crisis-hit Kingfisher Airlines looks set to cancel more flights on Thursday and coming days. On Wednesday, oil companies pulled the plug on supply to the cash-strapped airlines due to non-payment of dues. http://ibnlive.com/livetv

media:group.media:description: It couldn't have gotten worse for the people looking to celebrate the festival of colours with their near and dear ones. Crisis-hit Kingfisher Airlines looks set to cancel more flights on Thursday and coming days. On Wednesday, oil companies pulled the plug on supply to the cash-strapped airlines due to non-payment of dues. http://ibnlive.com/livetv
media:group.media:keywords: Kingfisher Airlines, KFA, Income Tax Department, IATA, Oil companies, Flight cancellation
media:group.media:title: Passengers bear the brunt as Kingfisher crisis continues

entry.title: Australian Employers Unexpectedly Cut Jobs in February
entry.content: March 8 (Bloomberg) -- Australian employers unexpectedly cut workers in February for the third time in four months as a stronger currency hurt industries not benefiting from a surge in resource investment. The number of people employed fell by 15,400, the statistics bureau said in Sydney today. That compares with the median estimate for an increase of 5,000 in a Bloomberg News survey of 24 economists. The jobless rate rose to 5.2 percent from 5.1 percent. Shraysi Tandon reports on Bloomberg's "First Up" with Susan Li. (Source: Bloomberg)

media:group.media:description: March 8 (Bloomberg) -- Australian employers unexpectedly cut workers in February for the third time in four months as a stronger currency hurt industries not benefiting from a surge in resource investment. The number of people employed fell by 15,400, the statistics bureau said in Sydney today. That compares with the median estimate for an increase of 5,000 in a Bloomberg News survey of 24 economists. The jobless rate rose to 5.2 percent from 5.1 percent. Shraysi Tandon reports on Bloomberg's "First Up" with Susan Li. (Source: Bloomberg)
media:group.media:keywords: Australian, Employers, Unexpectedly, Cut, Jobs, in, February, All, Media, Video, Asia, ex., Japan, Australia, Pacific, Rim, Audio, Visual, New, Zealand, Bloomberg, Bond, Market, News, Central, Banks, Commodities, Company, Country, Economies, Currencies, Economic, English, Multimedia, Labor, Unions
media:group.media:title: Australian Employers Unexpectedly Cut Jobs in February

entry.title: FDA Issues Warning to Inhalable Caffeine Maker
entry.content: Food and Drug Administration officials have issued a warning letter to the makers of the inhalable caffeine product AeroShot, saying they have questions about its safety and concerns about how children and adolescents may use it. (March 7)

media:group.media:description: Food and Drug Administration officials have issued a warning letter to the makers of the inhalable caffeine product AeroShot, saying they have questions about its safety and concerns about how children and adolescents may use it. (March 7)
